summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident documenting the events of July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM, when inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) after an apparent suicide attempt. The report details the response, observations of Epstein's condition, his transport to medical, and his placement on suicide watch.

M. M., a medical practitioner, examined and treated Epstein for injuries sustained during the incident.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt in SHU
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, a call for assistance was made in the Special Housing Unit. Jeffrey Epstein was found lying on his cell floor, breathing heavily and snoring, with a red neck. He was non-responsive to verbal calls but was observed flickering his eyes. He was restrained, placed on a stretcher, taken to the HA-Unit, dressed in a suicide smock, and placed on suicide watch.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU), 9 SOUTH SHU, Main Facility
keyFacts: The incident occurred on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell (Z05-124LAD) lying on the floor in a fetal position, breathing heavily and snoring, with a red neck but no visible abrasions.
Epstein was observed to flicker his eyes and shut them hurriedly when making eye contact with staff, suggesting he may have been conscious and aware.
He was treated by a medical practitioner (MLP M. M.) for a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck, marks of friction, and a small erythema on his left knee.
The report lists another inmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, as involved, but his specific role in the incident is not described in the provided text.
